definition: to postpone/to keep putting sth off

sentences.english: Procrastination at the top during a crisis antagonized the board of directors.
sentences.chinese: 公司高管在危机中的延宕促使董事会奋起行动。

sentences.english: These two factors delayed scientific field studies for nearly 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 这两个因素造成科学实地研究延宕了近20年。

sentences.english: An administrative hitch delayed the sale of the property.
sentences.chinese: 一个行政上的小问题延宕了这笔房地产买卖。

sentences.english: The push to stimulate the economy, many say, has undercut the environmental agenda.
sentences.chinese: 很多人说，经济刺激的推进延宕了环保的议事进程。

sentences.english: Our company will reserve the right to cancel this order or reject the goods for any lingested landing.
sentences.chinese: 本公司保存破除此订单或圮绝任何延宕的货物的权益。

sentences.english: Tie Ning slater novels are characterized by the exposition of peoples desire and the employment of delayed narration.
sentences.chinese: 欲望之旅和延宕叙事是铁凝后期小说的两大魅力之源。

sentences.english: How do we represent the constantly temporalized reality?
sentences.chinese: 如何表征那种被不断延宕的现实？

sentences.english: This delay may not be an entirely bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 这样的延宕或许不完全是坏事。

definition: lit. slow no aid to urgent (idiom); slow measures will not address a critical situation/too slow to meet a pressing need
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly
to reach a verdict/to conclude a judgment
